comments:
I am unable to navigate a Repository tree that contains .cvsignore files.

Steps to reproduce.

Switch to the CVS Perspective
add a repository that has .cvsignore files
open the repository node
open the versions node
select the versions node
select "Refresh View" from the context menu
click a node that corresponds to a directory containing a .cvsignore file
The "+" symbol will dissapear

No known workarounds at this point.

The log file indicates a Null Pointer Exception.

Thanks for taking the time to address this.

 - Matt Munz

I am unable to reproduce this. Please attach the log file so we can see where 
the NPE is occuring.

I wasn't as accurate as I could have been.  It's not a NPE, but a 
NoSuchElementException.  And, although similar behavior shows in both "Show 
Folders" and "Show Modules" modes, the error only occurs in "Show Modules" 
mode.  

A good test case is the JBoss source tree.

:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/jboss

I noticed this behavior on one of my own source trees *only after 
adding .cvsignore files*.

The relevant .log exerpt:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Oct 01, 2002 10:36:32.655
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Oct 01, 2002 10:36:32.665
!MESSAGE java.util.NoSuchElementException
!STACK 0

	at java.util.StringTokenizer.nextToken(StringTokenizer.java:232)

The problem is caused by an invalid entry in the CVSROOT/modules file. The 
exception has been fixed in the 2.1 development stream so that the invalid 
entry is ignored.
